bots

Class Drone

  • java.lang.Object
    • bots.Bot
      • bots.Drone

  • public class Drone
extends Bot
    The Drone is a Bot that moves in squares and only ever fires in the direction it is facing. It also turns if it detects that it has hit something. Occasionally puts out a happy drone message.
    Version:
    1.0 (March 3, 2011)
    Author:
    sam.scott

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
        int x,
        int y)
        Draw the current Drone image
        Specified by:
        draw in class Bot
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw yourself on.
        x - The x location of the top left corner of the drawing area
        y - The y location of the top left corner of the drawing area

      • getMove

        public int getMove(BotInfo me,
          boolean shotOK,
          BotInfo[] liveBots,
          BotInfo[] deadBots,
          Bullet[] bullets)
        Move in squares and fire every now and then.
        Specified by:
        getMove in class Bot
        Parameters:
        me - A BotInfo object with all publicly available info about this Bot
        shotOK - True iff a FIRE move is currently allowed
        liveBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the other Bots currently in play
        deadBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the dead Bots littering the arena
        bullets - An array of all Bullet objects currently in play
        Returns:
        A legal move (use the constants defined in BattleBotArena)

      • incomingMessage

        public void incomingMessage(int botNum,
                   java.lang.String msg)
        Required abstract method
        Specified by:
        incomingMessage in class Bot
        Parameters:
        botNum - The ID of the Bot who sent the message, or BattleBotArena.SYSTEM_MSG if the message is from the referee.
        msg - The text of the message that was broadcast.
